channel.title: Hello there!
channel.description:
Well hola! Long time and no uh...login or speaking with anyone. Thought i'd drop by and say hello :D. So, why the long ass disappearance? Well basically soon as it turned september and 6th form started i had literally NO-TIME...man you get so much more work :(...in addition, i had to start a part-time job to go to Costa rica and do community projects and trekking and cool stuff like that there for a month...which was amazzzzzzing!...best month of my life. But i was too busy to run RSR, spend time with friends, work, and do school work. Anyway, how is everyone? And for those who are in my year (year 13) how goes your university choices and junk? :)
Thought i'd post a couple of picts from costa rica anyway :).
What we say on our final day
[img]http://photos-b.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/n1069362184_117929_3250.jpg[/img] The amazing view from my hammock :D. [img]http://photos-g.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/n1069362184_117926_2235.jpg[/img]
Playing bulldog in torrential rain...all paths turned to rivers.
[img]http://photos-e.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/n1069362184_117932_6520.jpg[/img]
I hate spiders :(
[img]http://photos-a.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/n1069362184_117928_2904.jpg[/img]
Last day of a 5 day jungle trek...a dog (we called it stinky in the end) followed us 5k through it...then when we arrived at some camping place they took him back :(...we saw him few days after though...still stinky. Wild-life was amazing though [img]http://photos-e.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/s1069362184_117372_2340.jpg[/img] Us by a small waterfall [img]http://photos-g.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/n1069362184_117350_3594.jpg[/img]
Saw this from our hostel window each morning we stayed in la fortuna. Hostal was beautiful....we climed a mountain equal to this volcanoes hight the next day...to get a better view of it...steepest thing i've ever climbed...including my stairs! [img]http://photos-a.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v295/163/71/1069362184/n1069362184_117216_524.jpg[/img]
Played footie against locals and lost very badly lmao...most of the girls were better then they guys we had!!! (im one in middle, pink shirt...tallest one :D) [img]http://photos-b.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v310/89/65/657865547/n657865547_3912977_7456.jpg[/img]
Me taking a stroll through the rainforest...as you do. [img]http://photos-a.ll.facebook.com/photos-ll-snc1/v322/89/65/657865547/n657865547_3913688_201.jpg[/img]
First day at da airport..im the one right of the guy with yellow t-shirt [img]http://photos-g.ak.fbcdn.net/photos-ak-sf2p/v299/38/96/599066376/n599066376_1159774_4856.jpg[/img] We had like 10k pictures between the 22 of us...so these are just a few.
Breakfast! On the few occasions we wern't in a tent :). [img]http://photos-f.ll.facebook.com/photos-ll-sf2p/v299/38/96/599066376/n599066376_1159805_9816.jpg[/img]
Anyways, i just wanted to share this with everyone :)
Pura vida!

item.title: Hello there!
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

WB. amazing adventure. currently saving up to go on a Borneo expedition next year. cant wait for it. im also looking in to going to Africa to do some volunteer work.

wb again.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello there!
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:28, topic:242538”][quote author=Taios link=topic=318865.msg2528798#msg2528798 date=1226353071]
Trekked through rain forest to camp on a black sand beach with crystal clear warm waters that glowed in the dark.
Visited volcano which we could see from our bed erupting at night
[/quote]
Do you have any pictures of the beach/volcano? Those sound like amazing sights; especially the beach at night. :)[/quote]

I’ll see if i can find a picture from someone of the volcano errupting in the dark. (i just need to finish some coursework and junk first)
There’s a general picture on the first page of the topic if the volcano, exactly as i saw from my door. We also made pancakes during out time here lol, was a v.nice breakfast :D.
And we couldn’t get a picture of the beach at night :(. My teacher who went said it was because of a special algy in the water…when the waves crashed and came near you, you could see sparkles in it.
There were loads of fireflies as well lighting up the outside by our tents, and the most stars i’ve eveer seen in the sky (because of no light pollution)…unfortunately, these things wouldn’t come out on our cameras :(.
We even tried filming them but it didnt work either.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello there!
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Trekked through rain forest to camp on a black sand beach with crystal clear warm waters that glowed in the dark.

OMG TAIOS IS RADIOACTIVE NOW

I wish I could do something like that actually sounds good fun. Only thing I’m doing for the third world is this Wednesday I’m going to swim 5 miles none stop. Whoooop. Fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello there!
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:20, topic:242538”][quote author=Taios link=topic=318865.msg2528251#msg2528251 date=1226324380]
O cul, how you been keeping?
[/quote]
Good. What kind of stuff did you do on your trip?[/quote]

Shit loads!
1k Zip wiring over the top of the rain forest!
Also did a tarzan swing that went fucking high! Got a video of it somewhere as well.
Hot springs
White water rafting
Snorkling and seeing dolphins & whales
Community projects like building a suspension bridge, cleaning beach, throwing a small party for some kids(parents were ecstatic at the toys we brought em !), paining town hall.
Tekked up two mountains…one took 4 hours…the other took 2 days.
Trekked through rain forest to camp on a black sand beach with crystal clear warm waters that glowed in the dark.
Visited volcano which we could see from our bed erupting at night
Saw lots of wildlife :)…someone in out group who is reptile crazy started poking a fully fledged boa constrictor lmao…teachers went maaaaaad.

And yea :D, probs loads else i forgotten.
Was amazing :).

What about you? What have you been up to?

Read full topic

item.title: Hello there!
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:6, topic:242538”]Ha, how nice of you (Poor mother)

Well you should have totally applied to Bristol and joined me and Stork (Presuming I get in).

Edinburgh is nice, nearly went there but I didn’t get high enough on the UKCAT to think I’d stand a decent chance. I’ve heard York is great for compSci, although so is Bristol cough (Stork does it there). Nottingham has high guncrime so if we go there’ll we’ll get shot and get a great course!

I’m sure you’ll remember Yakman, he’s applying for Physics (mainly at London Unis). I also believe Cambridge. I ditched my application to Oxford in order to avoid taking the BMAT test.

And “Greeny” is literally the definition of procrastination.[/quote]
hehe, i was aiming for the more ‘beautiful’ and peaceful places(edinburgh, york, nottingham(campus is anyway) and leamington spar just by warwick)…although Southampton is not one of them, its a top 3 in the country for CS.
I was thinking of applying for UCl…but really dont want to go into busy london.

Yea, edin will be hard to get into, speaking to ollie as well…and you have to do an introductory year which is going to be booooooring…but i went for the weekend with a mate and love edinburgh city…so thought might as well apply :d

[quote=“casey., post:7, topic:242538”]Costa Rica’s a nice vacation spot, I enjoyed it when I went their.

Welcome back.[/quote]

yea sure is :). people generally are really friendly too…(not in san jose though lol)

Read full topic
